Sales and Marketing Executive Job at Erisco Foods Limited




        
    

        
        Erisco Foods Limited is an indigenous food product manufacturer, incorporated in Nigeria in 2004 and started operations in 2009, manufacturing Tomato Paste, Seasoning, Rice, Milk cubes and more. We are firmly committed to producing high-quality products that combine nourishment with value pricing, as they strive to become one of Nigeria’s largest indigenous foodmanufacturers on a global scale.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales and Marketing Executive

Job Locations: Benin, Edo and Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking proactive and results-driven Sales and Marketing Executives to join our dynamic team in Benin and Port Harcourt.
	The ideal candidates will be responsible for driving sales growth, expanding market share, and building strong customer relationships within their assigned territory.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement effective sales strategies to meet company targets.
	Identify new business opportunities and follow up on potential leads.
	Manage relationships with existing clients and ensure customer satisfaction.
	Conduct market research to understand customer needs, market trends, and competitor activities.
	Execute promotional campaigns and sales initiatives.
	Maintain accurate records of sales, revenue, and client interactions.
	Provide regular reports on sales activities and performance.


Requirements


	Minimum of HND or B.Sc. in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field.
	1–3 years of proven experience in sales or marketing, preferably in FMCG or a similar sector.
	Strong communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
	Goal-oriented with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Must reside in Benin or Port Harcourt.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@ersicofoodsltd.com.ng using the Job Position and Location (e.g., Sales Executive – Port Harcourt) as the subject of the mail.

Method of Application
Interested and qualfiied candidates should send their Application and CV to: lawfirmrecruit1@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Interested and qualfiied candidates should send their Application and CV to: lawfirmrecruit1@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Inventory Logistics Officer Job at Eden-UK Pharmaceuticals




        
    

        
        Eden-UK Pharmaceuticals, We proudly offer a diverse portfolio of over 30 pharmaceutical products that cut across essential therapeutic areas — includinganti-malarial, antibiotics, anti-hypertensive, and a range of othertherapeutic drugs. Our offerings also extend tosurgical products and medical devices, meeting critical healthcare needs in both urban and rural communities.

At Eden-UK Pharmaceuticals, we are not just in the business of medicine,we are in the business of hope, healing, and health. Our team is driven by passion, guided by science, and committed to excellence. We believe that healthcare is a right, not a privilege, and our goal is to make quality treatment accessible to all.
     

            
    



Whether you are a healthcare professional, distributor, or aspiring talent looking to build a meaningful career.Eden-UK Pharmaceuticalsoffers a dynamic environment that values integrity, innovation, and impact.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Logistics Officer

Job Location: Onitsha, Anambra

Job Description


	The Inventory / Logistics Officers will be responsible for managing stock levels, coordinating supply chain operations, and ensuring efficient warehousing and distribution of pharmaceutical products.
	This role requires strong attention to detail, compliance with regulatory requirements (e.g., GDP/GMP), and the ability to work collaboratively across departments.


Responsibilities


	Monitor, record, and manage inventory levels to prevent stockouts or overstocking.
	Coordinate incoming and outgoing shipments, ensuring timely and accurate delivery.
	Maintain accurate stock records using inventory management systems.
	Conduct regular stock audits and reconcile discrepancies.
	Ensure all inventory and logistics processes comply with pharmaceutical regulations and quality standards.
	Liaise with suppliers, transporters, and internal departments to ensure seamless operations.
	Generate inventory reports and support forecasting and procurement planning.
	Ensure safe storage, handling, and distribution of pharmaceutical products in accordance with GDP/GMP standards.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree,HND or OND in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum 2 years of experience in inventory or logistics, preferably in a pharmaceutical or healthcare environment.
	Knowledge of pharmaceutical warehousing standards and regulatory compliance.
	Proficiency with inventory software and ERP systems.
	Strong organizational and analytical skills.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary
	Opportunity to grow within a fast-paced and mission-driven organization.
	Exposure to global best practices in pharmaceutical logistics and inventory management.
	Supportive team culture focused on continuous improvement and operational excellence.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: eliteconsultscribe@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: There is a need to fill this postions urgently and succesful candidates are expected to start immediately if interview is satisfactory.

REPTON Group is a company registered in Nigeria with the Corporate Affairs Commission to carry out business in general commerce, distribution, haulage, agriculture and allied services.

We are major Lafarge, Dangote, and Bua cement distributors across Nigeria. We distribute products across the 36 states of the Federation including FCT Abuja. In addition, we haul products from the factories in Obajana, Kogi State, Gboko, Benue State, Ibese, Ogun State and numerous distribution and sales depots. We are long standing Lafarge Cement & Dangote Cement Distributor respectively. Thus, we are very familiar with both the industry and the markets.
